bibl.title: Letter from William Crawford Gorgas to Henry Rose Carter, May 18, 1917

div1.p: Gorgas requests that Carter join a yellow fever board to work in South America for a year or more.

div1.head: Letter from William Crawford Gorgas to Henry Rose Carter, May 18, 1917
div1.opener:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL,
WASHINGTON.
May 18,1917.
Dr. Henry R. Carter,
U.S. Public Health Service,
Marine Hospital,
New Orleans, Louisiana.
Dear Carter:
div1.p:
I am trying to arrange a board to look
into the Yellow Fever question in Brazil,
Venezuela, and contiguous countries. Guiteras
has agreed to go and take with him his
pathologist. I planned that the board will
be occupied a year or more. ShouldCould you join
Guiteras, theIn terms would be the same as on
our former trip. I would expect to join
you whenever my work in Washington is finished.

I was in Baltimore yesterday and saw
Laura and Henry. Laura, I think, is looking
better than I have every seen her before.
Mrs. Gorgas joins me in kindest regards.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, W. C. Gorgas. WCG-HHW
